translation.en: Your Honor, please.
Dr. Cartwright came to us in good conscience...
...as an eyewitness to the exorcism on Father Moore's tape.
translation.es: ...como testigo presencialdel exorcismo del padre Moore.

translation.en: He can substantiate all of my client's testimony--
Your Honor, the defense has already presented its exorcism testimony...
translation.es: La defensa ya presentó su testimoniodel exorcismo...

translation.en: ...in dramatic fashion. Do we really have to--?
We have absorbed some extraordinary testimony today.
I think we'll take some time to consider it.
Court is adjourned until 9:30 tomorrow morning.
translation.es: Se levanta la sesiónhasta las 9:30 de mañana.

translation.en: -You can't find him? -I went to meet him, he didn't show.
translation.es: -¿No lo encuentras?-No vino a la cita.

translation.en: I called his office, I called his house.
translation.es: Llamé a su oficina, a su casa.

translation.en: Okay. Go to the hospital, ask around. Somebody's gotta know where he is.
translation.es: Ve y pregunta en el hospital.Alguien debe saber dónde está.

translation.en: What the hell happened?
Tell Father Moore I'm sorry.
translation.es: Dígale al padre Moore que lo siento.

translation.en: Tell him I know the demons are real and I admire his courage...
translation.es: Sé que los demonios son realesy admiro su coraje...

translation.en: ...for standing and speaking against them.
Tell him I know what they can do.
translation.es: Dígale que sé lo que hacen.

translation.en: -Cartwright's dead. -I heard.
Are you drunk?
-Not yet, but I'm working on it. -Have you seen this?
-What the hell were you thinking? -Karl....
You told me you'd talk him out of testifying.
Instead, you put on a freak show with taped demons...
translation.es: En cambio, montas un showcon demonios grabados...

translation.en: ...and a dead girl speaking in tongues...
...and your client testifies that the archbishop sanctioned the exorcism.
translation.es: ...y tu cliente declara queel arzobispo autorizó el exorcismo.

translation.en: We'll be lucky if the archdiocese isn't named--
translation.es: Con suerte, no mencionarána la arquidiócesis...

translation.en: I had a doctor who was gonna corroborate.
translation.es: Tenía un doctorque iba a corroborarlo.

translation.en: Besides that, Father Moore's testimony's crucial to his defense.
translation.es: El testimonio del padre Moorees crucial para su defensa.

translation.en: Did you forget the archdiocese is paying for this defense?
The archdiocese isn't on trial.
translation.es: La arquidiócesis no está en juicio.

translation.en: I swore an oath to do what's best for my client.
translation.es: Juré hacer lo mejor para mi cliente.

translation.en: Spare me the law school pieties, Bruner.
translation.es: Ahórrate las frasesde la escuela de leyes.

translation.en: You cashed in your conscience at the door.
-People can change. -Like James Van Hopper?
It's not over.
I can put Mr. Rose on the stand...
...to corroborate Father Moore about the exorcism.
And there are the girls. Her sister Alice, she saw part of it.
translation.es: Y están las chicas.Su hermana Alice lo vio.

translation.en: They all look like superstitious rubes. They've got no credibility.
Thomas will rip them to pieces.
You'll be worse off than you are now, if that's possible.
You're gonna replace me on this case.
You've screwed it up beyond all repair.
But the archdiocese feels that replacing you now...
...would only draw more unnecessary attention to the trial.
But just so we're clear, Bruner...
...if you put that priest on the stand again, I will fire you.
translation.es: Si el sacerdote vuelve al estrado,te despido.

translation.en: You've been crying.
-Dr. Cartwright is dead. -What?
He was killed. There was an accident. I'm sorry.
translation.es: Lo mataron.Hubo un accidente. Lo siento.

translation.en: I know he was your friend.
We've lost.
Without his testimony, it's over.
No, no, no, it isn't over. We're telling Emily's story. That's what matters.
translation.es: No, acabó. Contaré la historiade Emily. Es lo que importa.

translation.en: -It can't be worth all this. -Yes, it is worth it.
Just let me go back on the stand and tell the rest of the story.
translation.es: Déjeme regresar y contarel resto de la historia.

translation.en: -I can't do that. -You must!
You must.
Erin, you once said that you felt you were on the right path.
translation.es: Erin, usted me dijoque se sentía en el buen camino.

translation.en: Don't stray from that path.
Here, take this.
-What is this? -Just read it.
And then decide what you want to do.
I saw your eyes today in court when I explained the significance of 3 a.m.
translation.es: Vi sus ojos cuando expliquéel significado de las 3:00 a.m.

translation.en: It's not going to stop until Emily's story is told.
translation.es: Esto no acabará hasta quecuente la historia de Emily.

translation.en: Are you gonna make a statement?
Do you believe it was the devil?
Is the defense ready to proceed?
Yes, Your Honor. The defense recalls Father Richard Moore.
translation.es: Sí, Su Señoría. La defensa llamaal padre Richard Moore.

translation.en: The witness is reminded that he is still under oath.
translation.es: Que el testigo recuerdeque está bajo juramento.

translation.en: -When did you last see Emily alive? -The night before she died.
translation.es: -¿Cuándo la vio viva por última vez?-La noche antes de su muerte.

translation.en: Her mother, Maria, called me and said that Emily had asked for me.
translation.es: Su madre me llamó diciendoque Emily preguntaba por mí.

translation.en: -Why did she ask to see you? -To give me this.
Did Emily explain to you the letter's significance?
translation.es: ¿Emily le explicóel significado de la carta?

translation.en: Yes. She said she'd written it the morning after the failed exorcism...
translation.es: Sí. La escribió la mañana siguienteal fallido exorcismo...

translation.en: ...and that it was important for me to share.
translation.es: ...y dijo que era importanteque yo la compartiera.

translation.en: Father Moore, was Emily a good person?
I believe that one day Emily will be recognized as a saint.
translation.es: Creo que algún díareconocerán a Emily como santa.

translation.en: -So she loved God. -Yes. She was very devout.
translation.es: -Ella amaba a Dios.-Sí, era muy devota.

translation.en: Father Moore, if Emily loved God...
...if she was so good and so devout, why do you think God...
translation.es: ...si era tan buena y devota,¿por qué Dios...

translation.en: -...allowed this to happen? -Objection.
What is the relevance of that question?
Father Moore's belief in this matter is crucial...
translation.es: La opinión del padre es crucial...

translation.en: ...in establishing his and Emily's understanding of her condition.
translation.es: ...para establecer cómo amboscomprendían el cuadro de Emily.

translation.en: And that mutual understanding is paramount in determining...
translation.es: Y esta mutua comprensiónes primordial para determinar...

translation.en: ...whether Father Moore was, in fact, negligent.
I'm going to allow it.
Your Honor, you're not really gonna let someone testify...
...about why God would allow the death of a young girl?
translation.es: ...por qué Dios permitióla muerte de una joven?

translation.en: The objection has been overruled.
Again, Father Moore:
Why did God allow Emily to become possessed by demons and then die?
translation.es: ¿Por qué Dios permitió que Emilyfuera poseída y luego muriera?

translation.en: I can let Emily answer that.
"Last night, on Allhallows' Eve...
translation.es: "En vísperas del Díade Todos los Santos...

translation.en: ...Father Moore tried to cast six demons from my body.
translation.es: ...el padre Moore intentó echarde mi cuerpo a seis demonios.

translation.en: They refused to go.
After the attempted exorcism...."
I was taken to my room, and I fell into a deep sleep.
translation.es: Me llevaron a mi cuarto,y caí en un sueño profundo.

translation.en: I awoke a few hours later, hearing a voice calling out my name.
translation.es: Horas después me despertó una vozque decía mi nombre.

translation.en: "Again, I heard a voice calling my name.
translation.es: "Otra vez, escuché una vozque me llamaba.

translation.en: It was the Blessed Holy Mother of God.
translation.es: Era la Bendita Santa Madre de Dios.

translation.en: And when I looked at her...
...she smiled at me and said:
'Emily, heaven is not blind to your pain.'"
translation.es: 'Emily, el cielo no es ciegoante tu dolor'".

translation.en: She said the Virgin Mary spoke to her in the middle of a field?
translation.es: ¿Dijo que la Virgen María le hablóen medio de un campo?

translation.en: -Yes. -And do you believe her?
I believe Emily spoke the truth.
translation.es: Creo que Emily dijo la verdad.

translation.en: Please continue.
"I asked the Blessed Mother, 'Why do I suffer like this?'"
translation.es: "Le pregunté a la Santa Madre,'¿Por qué sufro así?'"

translation.en: Why did the demons not leave me tonight?
translation.es: ¿Por qué los demoniosno me abandonaron esta noche?

translation.en: "She said, 'I am sorry, Emily.
The demons are going to stay where they are.'
Then she said, 'You can come with me in peace...
translation.es: Luego ella dijo:'Puedes venir conmigo en paz...

translation.en: ...free of your bodily form...
...or you can choose to continue this.
You will suffer greatly.
But through you, many will come to see that the realm of the spirit is real.
translation.es: Pero gracias a ti, muchos veránque el reino del espíritu es real.

translation.en: The choice is yours.'"
I choose to stay.
"In the end, good will triumph over evil.
translation.es: "Al final, el bientriunfará sobre el mal.

translation.en: Through my experience...
...people will know that demons are real.
translation.es: ...la gente sabráque los demonios son reales.

translation.en: People say that God is dead.
translation.es: La gente dice que Dios está muerto.

translation.en: But how can they think that...
...if I show them the devil?"
Did you see these wounds on both of Emily's hands and both feet?
translation.es: ¿Vio las heridasen manos y pies de Emily?

translation.en: Yes. Yes, the wounds lasted for some time.
translation.es: Sí, las heridas duraron un tiempo.

translation.en: And did you attach any supernatural significance to these wounds?
I believe they were stigmata.
By that, you mean supernatural injuries...
...that correspond to the crucifixion wounds of Jesus Christ?
translation.es: ...que corresponden a las heridasde Cristo crucificado?

translation.en: Yes.
Stigmata are a sign, a mark indicating one is touched by God.
translation.es: Los estigmas indicanque alguien es tocado por Dios.

translation.en: After that night, why do you think Emily refused another exorcism?
translation.es: Después de esa noche, ¿por qué creeque Emily se negó a otro exorcismo?

translation.en: I believe she'd accepted her fate.
translation.es: Creo que ella aceptó su destino.

translation.en: Is there anything else you'd like to say about Emily?
The defense rests.
Father Moore attaches divine significance...
...to the wounds on Emily's hands and feet.
translation.es: ...a las heridas de Emilyen manos y pies.

translation.en: Why?
Because he sees them as confirmation of what he wants to believe.
translation.es: Porque las ve como la confirmaciónde lo que él desea creer.

translation.en: That Emily was a saint, touched by the hand of God.
translation.es: Que Emily era una santa,tocada por la mano de Dios.

translation.en: I'm afraid the truth is far less inspiring.
translation.es: Me temo que la verdades menos inspiradora.

translation.en: Because the truth is, by the time these miraculous wounds appeared...
...Emily had already shown a tendency to injure herself...
translation.es: ...Emily ya era proclivea herirse a sí misma...

translation.en: ...and simply did so again on one of the barbed-wire fences...
translation.es: ...y volvió a hacerlo con el cercode alambre de púa...

translation.en: ...surrounding the Rose family farm.
translation.es: ...que rodea la fincade la familia Rose.

translation.en: Father Moore's beliefs are based on archaic and irrational superstition.
translation.es: La creencia del padre Moore se basaen superstición arcaica e irracional.

translation.en: Emily suffered because she was sick...
...not because she was a saint.
I'm a man of faith. And I am also a man of facts.
translation.es: Soy un hombre de fe.Pero también de hechos.

translation.en: And in here, facts are what must matter.
And these are the facts of this case:
translation.es: Y los hechos en este caso son:

translation.en: Emily Rose had epilepsy, which caused psychosis.
translation.es: Emily Rose padecía de epilepsiaque le provocó psicosis.

translation.en: And, given time, medicine would have cured her.
translation.es: Con el tiempo, la medicinala hubiera curado.

translation.en: But it didn't. Why? Because Father Richard Moore convinced Emily...
translation.es: Pero no fue así. ¿Por qué?Porque el padre la convenció...

translation.en: ...that she wasn't ill, that she didn't need medicine.
translation.es: ...de que no estaba enferma,de que no necesitaba medicina.

translation.en: And in the weeks leading up to her death...
translation.es: Y en las semanas previasa su muerte...

translation.en: ...when she was clearly in need of medical treatment...
...he failed to have her hospitalized.
So...
...the defense has given us an extraordinary...
...creative explanation for the events that led to this.
translation.es: ...y creativa explicaciónde los hechos que llevaron a esto.

translation.en: Ladies and gentlemen, don't you believe it.
translation.es: Damas y caballeros,ustedes no deben creerla.

translation.en: Because the fact is, it wasn't the devil that did this to Emily Rose.
translation.es: No fue el diabloquien le hizo esto a Emily Rose.

translation.en: It was the defendant.
Counselor.
Ethan Thomas calls himself a man of faith.
translation.es: Ethan Thomas se llama a sí mismo"hombre de fe".

translation.en: I, on the other hand, am a woman of doubt.
translation.es: Yo, por el contrario,soy mujer de duda.

translation.en: Angels and demons.
God and the devil.
These things either exist, or they do not exist.
translation.es: Estas cosas, existen o no existen.

translation.en: Are we all alone in this life?
Or are we not alone?
Either thought is astonishing.
Do I really believe that this tragedy is the work of the devil?
translation.es: ¿Realmente creo que esta tragediaes obra del demonio?

translation.en: To be honest, I don't know.
translation.es: Para ser honesta, no lo sé.

translation.en: But I cannot deny that it's possible.
translation.es: Pero no puedo negar que es posible.

translation.en: The prosecution wants you to believe...
...that Emily's psychotic epileptic disorder was a fact...
...because facts leave no room for reasonable doubt.
translation.es: ...porque los hechosno dejan lugar a duda.

translation.en: But this trial isn't about facts.
translation.es: Pero este juiciono se trata de hechos...

translation.en: This trial is about possibilities.
Is it a fact that Emily was a hypersensitive...
...as Dr. Adani suggests?
A person who's more likely, by her very nature, to become possessed?
translation.es: ¿Es por su naturaleza, una personapropensa a ser poseída?

translation.en: I can't say that, but the question is:
translation.es: No puedo afirmarlo,pero la pregunta es:

translation.en: Is it possible?
Is it a fact that Gambutrol anesthetized Emily's brain...
translation.es: ¿Es un hecho que el Gambutrolanestesió su cerebro...

translation.en: ...so that the exorcism ritual was rendered ineffective?
I can't be sure of that.
But is it possible?
Is it a fact that Emily was beloved by God?
translation.es: ¿Es un hecho que Diosamaba a Emily?

translation.en: And that after her exorcism, she chose to suffer till the end...
translation.es: ¿Tras el exorcismo, ella escogiósufrir hasta el final...

translation.en: ...so that we might believe in a more magical world?
translation.es: ...para que creamosen un mundo más mágico...

translation.en: A world where the spiritual realm really exists?
I can't say that's a fact.
translation.es: No puedo decir que sea un hecho.

translation.en: But ask yourself:
Is it possible?
It's what Emily believed.
It's what Father Moore believed.
translation.es: Es lo que el padre Moore creyó.

translation.en: And that sincere belief is what determined her choices and his.
translation.es: Y esa creencia sinceradeterminó la elección de ambos.

translation.en: Now, for the most important question:
Is Father Richard Moore guilty...
...beyond a reasonable doubt, of negligent homicide?
translation.es: ...más allá de la duda razonable,de un homicidio negligente?

translation.en: Did he, in fact, neglect Emily's needs in such a way...
translation.es: ¿Negó las necesidades de Emilyde tal modo...

translation.en: ...that her death is now on his hands?
translation.es: ...que la muerte de ellaes su responsabilidad?

translation.en: No! That is not a fact.
It is not a fact that Emily was epileptic.
translation.es: No es un hechoque Emily fuera epiléptica.

translation.en: It is not a fact that she was psychotic.
translation.es: No es un hecho que fuera psicótica.

translation.en: Facts...
...leave no room for possibilities.
The only fact...
...the only thing I know beyond a doubt in this case...
translation.es: ...la única cosa en este caso,de la cual no dudo...

translation.en: ...is that Father Moore loved Emily with his whole heart.
translation.es: ...es que el padre Mooreamaba a Emily con todo su corazón.

translation.en: He did everything in his power to help her.
translation.es: Hizo todo lo posible a su alcancepara ayudarla.

translation.en: He has risked his very freedom so we could hear her story.
translation.es: Arriesgó su propia libertadpara que escucháramos la historia.

translation.en: Ladies and gentlemen of the jury...
...in my job I sometimes have to defend bad men.
translation.es: ...en mi profesión, a vecesdebo defender malos hombres.

translation.en: Father Richard Moore is not one of them.
translation.es: El padre Richard Mooreno es uno de ellos.

translation.en: Don't send a good man to prison.
translation.es: No envíen un buen hombre a prisión.

translation.en: I'm not asking that you believe everything that Father Moore believes.
translation.es: No pido que creanen todo lo que él cree.

translation.en: I'm simply asking that you believe in Father Moore.
translation.es: Simplemente pido que creanen el padre Moore.

translation.en: Madam Foreman, has the jury reached a verdict?
We have, Your Honor.
Please read the verdict out loud.
translation.es: Lea el veredicto en voz alta.

translation.en: "In the case of The People v. Father Richard Moore...
translation.es: "En el caso de El Pueblocontra el padre Richard Moore...

translation.en: ...we, the jury, find the defendant...
...guilty of negligent homicide."
The court thanks the jury for its service.
translation.es: El tribunal agradece al juradopor su servicio.

translation.en: Sentencing for this case will be set for April 3rd.
translation.es: La sentencia de este casose fija para el 3 de abril.

translation.en: Your Honor, if it pleases the court...
translation.es: Su Señoría, si el tribunallo permite...

translation.en: ...Father Moore requested at the start of trial...
...that if found guilty, he would be sentenced immediately.
translation.es: ...que de ser culpable,lo sentenciaran de inmediato.

translation.en: Yes, I recall that.
Does the prosecution have any objection to expedited sentencing?
translation.es: ¿El fiscal tiene alguna objeciónpara que se pronuncie sentencia?

translation.en: Very well.
Father Richard Moore, do you understand this sentence...
-...which has been found against you? -Yes, Your Honor.
And do you understand the gravity of this crime?
That you may, under the law, be sentenced to a term of up to 10 years?
translation.es: ¿Y que podría sentenciarlopor un término de hasta 10 años?

translation.en: Yes, I do.
Are there any statements you wish to make...
...before I impose this sentence?
-No, Your Honor. -Very well.
Excuse me, Your Honor...
...but the jury would like to make a recommendation...
-...regarding the sentence. -Objection.
Sit down, counselor.
It's only a recommendation, and I would like to hear it.
We recommend a sentence of time served.
translation.es: Recomendamos se dépor cumplida la sentencia.

translation.en: I'll accept that.
You are guilty, Father Moore.
And you are free to go.
-This court is dismissed. -All rise.
Thank you.
Well, you shocked us all.
Everyone at the firm sees this as another victory.
translation.es: Todos en la compañíalo consideran otra victoria.

translation.en: The archdiocese is pleased.
They feel the trial has raised public interest in the Church.
translation.es: El juicio aumentóel interés público en la iglesia.

translation.en: Have you seen the news?
There's our priest, leaving the courthouse a free man...
...right next to you.
Just like James Van Hopper.
All right, I'll say it. I was wrong.
But I'm ready to make it right.
I'm offering you a full partnership in the firm.
Keep it.
Will you be able to return to your parish?
I can't go back.
Not now.
Once you've looked into the darkness...
translation.es: Una vez que miras la oscuridad...

translation.en: ...I think you carry it with you for the rest of your life.
translation.es: ...la llevas contigopor el resto de tu vida.

translation.en: What about you?
I believe you've seen the darkness too.
I don't know.
I'm not sure what I've seen.
translation.es: No estoy segura de lo que vi.

translation.en: -Who chose the epitaph? -I did.
It's from the second chapter of Philippians, verse 12.
translation.es: Es del segundo capítulode Filipenses, versículo 12.

translation.en: Emily recited it to me the night before she died.
translation.es: Emily me lo recitóla noche antes de morir.
